feed.title: Rafal Kucharski Lab
feed.subtitle: Urban Mobility Lab at Jagiellonian University, Poland: Where transport engineering meets network science and machine learning.

entry.title: 2026 AAAS Annual Meeting is coming
entry.content:
ğŸ— This Saturday, join us for an exciting discussion on the future of urban mobility! On February 14, 2026, Rafal will be presenting at the AAAS Annual Meeting â€“ Science @ Scale in Phoenix, Arizona.

As part of a session organized by the European Research Council (ERC) alongside Cristina Grasseni, Monika Salzbrunn, and Silvia Grassi, they will explore â€œA Path to Building Better Citiesâ€. Rafalâ€™s talk highlights how Connected and Autonomous Vehicles (CAVs), like Waymo, may affect urban systems as they scale up, sharing public space with â€œhuman road usersâ€. Results range from cautious to optimistic, emphasizing the need for thoughtful safeguards in urban mobility.

Donâ€™t miss it â€“ save the date and join us in shaping the cities of tomorrow!

Presentation

entry.title: Presentation at the AETâ€“CEETRA Joint Seminar

link.title: Presentation at the AETâ€“CEETRA Joint Seminar

entry.content:
Today, RafaÅ‚ presents his recent research at the joint seminar of the Association for European Transport (AET) and the Central European Excellence in Transportation Research Association (CEETRA).

In his talk, RafaÅ‚ will introduce the concept of Post-Wardropian Urban Mobility Games with Connected Autonomous Vehicles, which summarizes key findings from our ERC COeXISTENCE project.

The session will be co-presented with Roxani Gkavra and moderated by Jacek Pawlak.

See slides here
entry.summary: Rafal Kucharski presenting at the joint seminar of Association for European Transport (AET) and Central European Excellence in Transportation Research Association

entry.title: Last year, we closed on a strong note

link.title: Last year, we closed on a strong note

entry.content:
We are thrilled to inform that the publication, first-authored by MichaÅ‚ Bujak, has been published in the European Journal of Operational Research ğŸ’£

In this article we propose a personalised pricing strategy for ride-pooling that integrates traveller behaviour with shared-trip economics to maximise expected profitability while reducing vehicle mileage through population heterogeneity. For our team, this is a gratifying culmination of a very hard-working year ğŸ‹ï¸
entry.summary: A publication by the Rafal Kucharski's LAB has been published in the European Journal of Operational Research

entry.title: Balancing efficiency and safety: Meet the DEEN model

link.title: Balancing efficiency and safety: Meet the DEEN model

entry.content:
ğŸ’¡ How can we balance network efficiency with virus safety? In our study published in Social Network Analysis and Mining we show how the DEEN (Deep Epidemic Efficiency Network) model can: âœ… increase system efficiency âœ… reduce the risk of virus spread

We tested it on: ğŸš• ride-pooling services in New York City, ğŸ‡µğŸ‡± economic exchange between regions in Poland, ğŸŒ peer-to-peer information networks.

Example? Dividing 150 NYC taxi riders into 4 groups more than doubled the epidemic threshold, while system utility dropped by only 13%!
entry.summary: Members of RafaÅ‚ Kucharskiâ€™s Lab have published the results of their research in SNAM journal

entry.title: The last conference of the year with our participation

link.title: The last conference of the year with our participation

entry.content:
During one of the most prestigious conferences in the field of machine learning and artificial intelligence research, NeurIPS2025 our team presented how URB lays the foundation for smarter autonomous vehicle routing for future urban traffic ğŸš—

URB is a comprehensive benchmarking framework that standardizes AV routing evaluation in realistic traffic scenarios and makes research in this domain more accessible. The study also presents our initial leaderboard of MARL solutions. We hope that URB will catalyze advancements towards efficiency and equity for future urban traffic.

Weâ€™re thankful for all the great discussions and feedback! Leaving San Diego, weâ€™re full of energy and buzzing with new ideas.

Find out more about URB
entry.summary: Members of RafaÅ‚ Kucharskiâ€™s Lab attended the NeurIPS 2025 conference in San Diego

entry.title: Our SimFLEX publication is now available in Journal of Public Transportation ğŸ’£

link.title: Our SimFLEX publication is now available in Journal of Public Transportation ğŸ’£

entry.content:
ğŸ¤” Thinking about launching an on-demand feeder service in your city? ğŸ«¡ But where? And how will people travel?

ğŸ§ª Meet SimFLEX â€” a simulation framework that shows where on-demand feeder buses can be most effective, using spatial data, demand modelling, shared-ride creation, and traveller learning to deliver KPIs like attractiveness and waiting-time reduction.

ğŸ’¡ Bronowice or Skotniki in KrakÃ³w? â¡ï¸ Skotniki!

Our team at Jagiellonian University supported the City of Krakow in the HE SUM Project, contributing to the launch of the successful LajkBus.

Excellent work in Journal of Public Transportation is now available.
entry.summary: Rafal Kucharski's LAB latest publication in Journal of Public Transportation

entry.title: Rafal is attending TECH-ON! KrakÃ³w & MaÅ‚opolska Region

link.title: Rafal is attending TECH-ON! KrakÃ³w & MaÅ‚opolska Region

entry.content: Already today, during TECH-ON! KrakÃ³w & MaÅ‚opolska Region RafaÅ‚, together with other invited speakers, will take part in the panel discussion Future City Innovations and in the debate Innovative Cities â€” What Are They Like?, moderated by dr hab. Jacek GÄ…decki from AGH University of Science and Technology. They will explore what makes a city truly innovative. Who, what, and how shapes cities that are future-ready, resilient to crises, and friendly to their residents? What types of innovations drive such urban development â€” technological, social, or systemic? What does it mean for a city to be innovative â€” and who makes it so, and how? This will be a great opportunity to present the latest research findings from our COeXISTENCE group ğŸ’¡ğŸ”
entry.summary: Rafal Kucharski will present at TECH-ON! KrakÃ³w & MaÅ‚opolska Region

entry.title: GMUM workshops 2025
entry.content: Another edition of the workshops organized by GMUM (Group of Machine Learning Research) is behind us, bringing with it many inspiring discussions on the applications of artificial intelligence, new ideas, and connections made. We look forward to continued collaboration and promising research!
entry.summary: Rafal Kucharski's LAB took part in GMUM workshops

entry.title: San Diego! Here we come!
entry.content:
Exciting news! ğŸ‰Our work URB â€“ Urban Routing Benchmark for RL-equipped Connected Autonomous Vehicles has been accepted to the prestigious NeurIPS 2025 conference!

Weâ€™re thrilled to share our research with the global AI community â€” and even more excited to be heading to San Diego this year. San Diego, here we come!
entry.summary: Rafal Kucharski Lab will present at NeurIPS 2025
